sources.data_found: Newton GPU cluster: 10 nodes × 2× V100 16GB; 11 nodes × 2× V100 32GB; 29 nodes × 2× H100 80GB PCIe; 4 nodes × 8× H100 80GB PCIe; plus an interactive node with 3× GTX980.
ARCC summary: Newton has 42 V100 GPUs (21 nodes) and H100 GPUs split as 58 H100 across 29 nodes plus 32 H100 across 4 nodes (total 90 H100).
RCI resource page: Newton cluster has 42 V100 GPUs and 90 H100 GPUs.
Announcement (Dec 12, 2024): ARCC installed four new 8-GPU (H100) nodes on Newton.
CASS EECS lab GPU Cluster: nine rack servers, each with four NVIDIA GeForce GTX Titan XP GPU cards.

student_data.notes: From UCF Department of Computer Science -> Accreditation page. In the tables labeled (1) 'Undergraduate Fall Enrollment and Annual Bachelor's Degrees Granted' the row for Academic Year 2024-25 shows 'Computer Science B.S.' Fall Enrollment = 3950. (2) In 'Master's Fall Enrollment and Annual Master's Degrees Granted' the row for Academic Year 2024-25 shows 'Computer Science M.S.' Fall Enrollment = 284 (masters-only). (3) In 'Doctoral Fall Enrollment and Annual Doctoral Degrees Granted' the row for Academic Year 2024-25 shows 'Computer Science Ph.D.' Fall Enrollment = 164. Page does not display a visible 'last updated' date.

other_high_vram_gpus.note: CASS EECS lab GPU Cluster: 9 servers × 4 Titan XP per server
ARCC Newton interactive visualization node: triple GTX980

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters found with GPU specs:

1) UCF ARCC Newton GPU cluster:
- V100 16GB: 10 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 20 V100
- V100 32GB: 11 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 22 V100
  => v100_count total = 20 + 22 = 42
- H100 80GB PCIe: 29 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 58 H100
- H100 80GB PCIe: 4 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 32 H100
  => h100_pcie_count total = 58 + 32 = 90
- Also mentioned (not in requested model fields): 1 interactive visualization node with 3 × GTX980

2) UCF CASS EECS lab GPU Cluster (departmental/lab, not ARCC):
- Titan XP: 9 servers × 4 GPUs/server = 36 Titan XP

No UCF clusters with H200, A100 (40/80GB), P100, A6000, L40S, B100/B200, GH200, or A40 were found in the provided searches above. Also, no UCF cluster named 'Sherlock' was found in these results (the well-known 'Sherlock' GPU cluster appears to be at Stanford, not UCF), so no 'Sherlock' estimation was applied.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
